title: GCC_INSTALL_PREFIX in llvm+clang not set correctly with system GCC on Ubuntu 20.04

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

On Ubuntu 20.04 with the system GCC 9.3.0, LLVM gets built with `-DGCC_INSTALL_PREFIX=/` when the compiler paths are `/bin/gcc` -- which was the default in my case (compilers are added with `spack compiler find`). The correct prefix is `/usr` I guess.

```console
$ cat ~/.spack/linux/compilers.yaml | grep -A5 9.3.0
    spec: gcc@9.3.0
    paths:
      cc: /bin/gcc
      cxx: /bin/g++
      f77: /bin/gfortran
      fc: /bin/gfortran
$ spack install llvm+clang
$ spack load llvm
$ cat main.cc 
#include <iostream>

int main() {
    std::cout << "hello\n";
}

$ clang++ main.cc 
main.cc:1:10: fatal error: 'iostream' file not found
#include <iostream>
         ^~~~~~~~~~
1 error generated.
```
### Information on your system

```
$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.15.3-455-7628e33f2
* **Python:** 3.8.2
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu20.04-zen2-->
```

Error was introduced by https://github.com/spack/spack/pull/12381

Pinging @sethrj 

### Additional information

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
